newsitem.title: JAPAN: NEC shares lifted by foreign buying.
newsitem.headline: NEC shares lifted by foreign buying.

text.p: Shares in NEC Corp rose in active trade on Thursday morning, due mainly to buying by foreign investors, brokers said.
At 0126 GMT, the shares were up 10 yen at 1,290 yen with 2.696 million shares traded. It was the most heavily traded issue on the first section of the Tokyo Stock Exchange.

Brokers said the rise of the yen to 112 to the dollar, stemming from a senior Finance Ministry official's remark suggesting the ministry was no longer interested in a weaker yen, was helping to pry foreign investors away from their recent net selling stance.
